results.title: Metformin Attenuates TGF-beta1-Induced Fibrosis in Salivary Gland: A Preliminary Study
results.text_hl: Overall, this study underscores the potential of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ as a promising therapeutic option for @<m>DISEASE_Salivary_Gland_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012466 @@@salivary gland fibrosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang L, Zhong NN, Wang X, Peng B, Chen Z, Wei L, Li B, Li Y, Cheng Y. Metformin Attenuates TGF-beta1-Induced Fibrosis in Salivary Gland: A Preliminary Study Int J Mol Sci. 2023 Nov 13;24(22):. PMID: 38003450

results.title: Metformin-induced activation of Ca2+ signaling prevents immune infiltration/pathology in Sjogren's syndrome-prone mouse models
results.text_hl: These results suggest that loss of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-mediated activation of Ca2+ signaling prevents ER stress, which inhibited the release of alarmins that induces immune cell infiltration leading to @<m>DISEASE_Salivary_Gland_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012466 @@@salivary gland dysfunction@@@ observed in @DISEASE_Sjogren's_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D012859 @@@pSS@@@.

citations.NLM: Nascimento Da Conceicao V, Sun Y, Chai X, Ambrus JL, Mishra BB, Singh BB. Metformin-induced activation of Ca2+ signaling prevents immune infiltration/pathology in Sjogren's syndrome-prone mouse models J Transl Autoimmun. 2023 Dec;7():100210. PMID: 37711153

results.title: AMPK Activation Restores Salivary Function Following Radiation Treatment.
results.text_hl: Treatment with @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@ activators, @CHEMICAL_AICA_ribonucleotide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C031143 @@@5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribonucleotide@@@ (@CHEMICAL_AICA_ribonucleotide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C031143 @@@AICAR@@@) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, attenuated compensatory proliferation (days 6, 7, and 30) following @DISEASE_HAIR_AN_syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C537629 @@@IR@@@ and reversed chronic (day 30) @<m>DISEASE_Salivary_Gland_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012466 @@@salivary gland dysfunction@@@ post-@DISEASE_HAIR_AN_syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C537629 @@@IR@@@.

citations.NLM: Meyer RK, Gilman KE, Rheinheimer BA, Meeks L, Limesand KH. AMPK Activation Restores Salivary Function Following Radiation Treatment. J Dent Res. 2023 Feb 1;():220345221148983. PMID: 36726289

results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Artesunate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077332 @@@Artesunate@@@ Combined With @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Ameliorate on @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes@@@-Induced @DISEASE_Xerostomia @DISEASE_MESH:D014987 @@@Xerostomia@@@ by Mitigating Superior Salivatory Nucleus and @<m>DISEASE_Salivary_Gland_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012466 @@@Salivary Glands Injury@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@Type 2 Diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@Rats@@@ via the @GENE_PIK3CB @GENE_85243 @@@PI3K@@@/@GENE_AKT1 @GENE_24185 @@@AKT@@@ Pathway
